title: How to Make Celery Soup

steps.headline: Wash the celery.
steps.description: Chop it into small pieces. Dispose of most of the leaves but keep some back.

steps.headline: Fry the chopped onion in the butter or oil in a large pot or saucepan.
steps.description: Fry without allowing it to go brown, over low heat, for about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the celery and fry for another 5 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: Stir occasionally to prevent the celery or onion from browning.

steps.headline: Pour in the stock or water.
steps.description: Place the lid on the pot or saucepan. Allow to simmer for 30 minutes. The celery should be tender at the end of the simmering.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Allow to cool a little. Pour the soup into a blender or a processor. Puree it until smooth. Season to taste.

steps.headline: Return to the pot or saucepan.
steps.description: Reheat very gently; you don't want it to get hot, just nicely warmed.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: You can sprinkle grated cheese on the bowl if wished, or some chopped celery leaves from those you've kept back.
